title: Minuteman Missile National Historic Site: Special Resource Study
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Publications     Special Resource Study              Special Resource Study (1995)          Minuteman Missile Sites: Special Resource Study (9MB PDF file) This special resource study team was commissioned in the early 1990s, immediately following the START treaty. A team including representatives from the National Park Service, US Air Force Museum, South Dakota Historical Society and the Ellsworth Heritage Foundation studied the sites and conducted a comprehensive evaluation of the historic resources. Through this report, it was decided that designation as a National Historic Site would be the best preservation option due to the National Park Service's mission "to protect and conserve" historic resources unimpaired for future generations.
